alert.note: Alert for West Slopes North Cascades and Passes; West Slopes North Central Cascades and Passes; West Slopes South Central Cascades and Passes (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 07 at 2:46PM PST until January 09 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM MONDAY TO 4 AM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TUESDAY TO 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 2000 feet, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 15 inches. For the Blizzard Warning above 2000 feet, blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 40 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Cascade mountains and valleys of Whatcom and Skagit Counties, including the Mount Baker Ski Area. Cascade mountains and valleys of Snohomish and King Counties, including Stevens Pass, and Snoqualmie Pass. Cascade mountains and valleys of Pierce and Lewis Counties, including the Crystal Mountain Ski Area, Paradise on Mount Rainier. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 7 AM Monday to 4 AM PST Tuesday. For the Blizzard Warning, from 4 AM Tuesday to 10 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A rain and snow mix is possible at Snoqualmie Pass Monday night as snow levels temporarily rise above pass level.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
